intro: Cryophytum crassipes, commonly known as the thick-stemmed frost plant, is a unique species adapted to cold environments. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features sturdy, fleshy stems that store water, aiding survival in arid or frost-prone regions. Its leaves are typically broad and lobed, often with a waxy surface to reduce moisture loss. Cryophytum crassipes is found in high-altitude areas and is of interest to botanists studying plant adaptations to extreme climates.
